> 
> **Felipe (HarvesteR):**
> 
> 
> - The Physics Bubble for vessels is no longer always set to 2.5km. Those values are now defined separately for each possible situation, so we now keep vessels in the atmosphere (or in sub-orbital trajectories) loaded up to 22.5km away. That means falling debris can now easily hit the ground (or KSC facilities) during launch, other vessels can reenter with you and actually hit the surface, quite a few interesting things.

Emphasis mine.

Specifically: orbiting craft are not in atmosphere. Bases are not on suborbital trajectories.

 The only two times I can think of that this might cause problems is during launch or if you have multiple craft flying in formation in atmosphere (or suborbitally). The first is by design; yes, you will see more lag if your rocket shreds itself, but that's the tradeoff SQUAD chose to make for the increased relevance of the actions of the debris (to wit, possibly damaging your space center or other craft in the area). The second seems like increased load distance is what you would want anyway, since flying in formation is impossible if your wingmen disappear.
From the East end of KSC runway to East end of the island runway is approx. 31.4km. Just flew it myself.

You should discard the notion of a 'bubble', it will only confuse you.

Maybe in some sense it helps to think of it that way with the current system (where everything that passes outside the 2km radius centered on the active vessel is put on rails), but not the new one.

The new system is more dynamic where every other vessel is handled on a case by case basis using its own situation as a criteria as to whether or not to go on or off rails.

> 
> It will, and we can more or less add Stage Recovery to the Big List O' Mods That Are Going To Be More Or Less Redundant After 1.0.
> Also, I'd love to have it so that all vehicles with deployed parachutes in atmo are always loaded; that way you could drop a parachute scout probe during your Duna/Eve/Laythe aerobrake, and have it parachute to the ground while you circularize your orbit with the mothership.

This. Combined with a possibly smaller than 22km physics bubble, it would enable more mission profiles without activating physics for every piece of debris within 22km of the launch pad. Or perhaps there could be some other way of designating a craft as "always loaded." A small, massless part? A tweak in the VAB?
